subject: XenAPI: Fix race on rotate_xen_guest_logs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-19 10:17:55.000000000', 'files': ['tools/xenserver/rotate_xen_guest_logs.sh'], 'message': 'XenAPI: Fix race on rotate_xen_guest_logs

There is a race between where Xen creates the domain and starts logging
and when XAPI returns to say that the domain has started.

If the cronjob to rotate the guest logs runs in this period, it can
delete the console logs before we set the last_dom_id which is used to
preserve logs.

This change adds a fixed delay before deleting any log files, allowing
the VM start operation to return after the domain has been successfully
created.

Change-Id: I82ae3e008974f33b60256366f171abf1f0369e60
Closes-Bug: 1535616
'}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: Fix race on rotate_xen_guest_logs

There is a race between where Xen creates the domain and starts logging
and when XAPI returns to say that the domain has started.

If the cronjob to rotate the guest logs runs in this period, it can
delete the console logs before we set the last_dom_id which is used to
preserve logs.

This change adds a fixed delay before deleting any log files, allowing
the VM start operation to return after the domain has been successfully
created.

Change-Id: I82ae3e008974f33b60256366f171abf1f0369e60
Closes-Bug: 1535616

commit_message:
Don't always run Octavia amphroa image build

****WIP - Do not merge****

Currently we are building the amphroa image for all gate jobs.
We need to limit this so we do not build the image for minimal
API tests.

Closes-bug: #1534198

commit_message:
Removed false warning about non-resolved dependencies

It is OK when some of dependendies do not resolved since
some roles are not assigned or only part of nodes are re-deployed.

Change-Id: I8ddda77a86ec7b8451d9700eb762d91d387b7bda
Closes-Bug: #1537542

revisions:

In model.py, there some subclasses of Model which are not calling the
parent's super() method in their own __init__() method.

The classes are:

VIF8021QbgParams (line 319)
VIF8021QbhParams (line 329)
NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper (line 489)

Closes-Bug: #1536281
"}]
commit_message:
Added super() call in some of the Model's child

In model.py, there some subclasses of Model which are not calling the
parent's super() method in their own __init__() method.

The classes are:

VIF8021QbgParams (line 319)
VIF8021QbhParams (line 329)
NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper (line 489)

Change-Id: I7a85f4963889b997ae47f4efa4e94f5eae6f3fb2
Closes-Bug: #1536281

commit_message:
Install vim text editor

Manila service image has old "vi" that provides very narrow set of
functionality. So, install better text editor - "vim".

Change-Id: I06443c7c9a3585c65b58b20919eb63727ffbeb62
Closes-Bug: #1535807

config option "port_range".

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2417, 'name': 'Ben Swartzlander', 'email': 'ben@swartzlander.org', 'username': 'bswartz'}, {'_account_id': 6491, 'name': 'xing-yang', 'email': 'xingyang105@gmail.com', 'username': 'xing-yang'}, {'_account_id': 7102, 'name': 'Thomas Bechtold', 'email': 'thomas.bechtold@canonical.com', 'username': 'toabctl'}, {'_account_id': 8851, 'name': 'Valeriy Ponomaryov', 'email': 'kiparis.kh@gmail.com', 'username': 'vponomaryov'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 11047, 'name': 'Mark Sturdevant', 'email': 'mark.sturdevant@ibm.com', 'username': 'markstur'}, {'_account_id': 11865, 'name': 'Clinton Knight', 'email': 'cknight@netapp.com', 'username': 'cknight'}, {'_account_id': 17097, 'name': 'Tiago Pasqualini da Silva', 'email': 'tiago.pasqualini@canonical.com', 'username': 'tiago.pasqualini'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-28 11:50:56.000000000', 'files': ['elements/manila-ubuntu-core/post-install.d/50-set-bash-as-default-shell'], 'message': 'Set bash as default shell

Default shell in manila service image does not allow to use history of
executed commands and lots of special actions, such as "home", "end", etc...
So, set 'bash' as default shell for manila service image to make life
of its users much better.

Change-Id: I35ae2e93cb7f81e6cb1a87a4d26a315785e6b078

commit_message:
Set bash as default shell

Default shell in manila service image does not allow to use history of
executed commands and lots of special actions, such as "home", "end", etc...
So, set 'bash' as default shell for manila service image to make life
of its users much better.

Change-Id: I35ae2e93cb7f81e6cb1a87a4d26a315785e6b078
Closes-Bug: #1535800

commit_message:
Disable oslotest LOG capturing

It would be really nice to actually be able to see
the logs that happen when a failure is triggered, so
this is an attempt to see if disabling LOG capturing
will make that possible.

Change-Id: Ia55d125de38b1843039fc7184bb24d00031e6682

commit_message:
Add more files to .gitignore

Add following elements to .gitignore:
- root dir called 'build' that is used by 'docs' tox job.
- vim temporary files
- pydev/eclipse project files
- log files with suffix '*.log'

Closes-Bug: #1538663

commit_message:
Don't log a failed software deployment at ERROR level

In terms of the logging guidelines this is not an ERROR, it's just a thing
that happened that is worth logging, so changing it to INFO level.

Also some reformatting because formatting.

Change-Id: Ic3222db3429a2b17fbea3d12056d16de17d21228

subject: Write complete pip.conf when nodes are ready
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-28 16:12:00.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/scripts/configure_mirror.sh'], 'message': "Write complete pip.conf when nodes are ready

Rather than trying to sed pip.conf, just write the whole thing.
This means we don't have to wait for image updates anymore.  It's
not clear to me why we didn't just do this once we started seding
it.

Change-Id: Ie6743e2a8f95f95cea19a0dbe9fceaedbff8bf94
"}]
commit_message:
Write complete pip.conf when nodes are ready

Rather than trying to sed pip.conf, just write the whole thing.
This means we don't have to wait for image updates anymore.  It's
not clear to me why we didn't just do this once we started seding
it.

Change-Id: Ie6743e2a8f95f95cea19a0dbe9fceaedbff8bf94

commit_message:
Forbid changing of 'cluster_id' parameter for node group

Changing of 'cluster_id' for already existing node group may lead to
unexpected behavior of nodes added to that group.

Closes-Bug: #1531512

subject: Prevent phantom user hooks
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-27 22:02:19.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': "Prevent phantom user hooks

Clear an active user hook when an exit exception occurs (e.g. the thread is
cancelled). Previously we only caught Exception so exit exceptions were
excluded.

To also cover the case of an unclean exit (e.g. kill -9), don't wait on a
hook that is left over from some previous stack operation - only start the
hook if it is set in the current environment.

Change-Id: Ie894f416a898edeca3b6a123392853213893ff74
Closes-Bug: #1538733
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent phantom user hooks

Clear an active user hook when an exit exception occurs (e.g. the thread is
cancelled). Previously we only caught Exception so exit exceptions were
excluded.

To also cover the case of an unclean exit (e.g. kill -9), don't wait on a
hook that is left over from some previous stack operation - only start the
hook if it is set in the current environment.

Change-Id: Ie894f416a898edeca3b6a123392853213893ff74
Closes-Bug: #1538733

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8735, 'name': 'Vitaly Kramskikh', 'email': 'vkramskikh@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vkramskikh'}, {'_account_id': 8766, 'name': 'Julia Aranovich', 'email': 'jkirnosova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'CesarSar'}, {'_account_id': 8882, 'name': 'Nastya Urlapova', 'email': 'aurlapova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'NastyaUrlapova'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9091, 'name': 'Alexandra Morozova', 'email': 'astepanchuk@mirantis.com', 'username': 'astepanchuk'}, {'_account_id': 9730, 'name': 'Kate Pimenova', 'email': 'kpimenova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'kpimenova'}, {'_account_id': 14057, 'name': 'Alexander Kurenyshev', 'email': 'akurenyshev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akurenyshev'}, {'_account_id': 19799, 'name': 'Grigory Mikhailov', 'email': 'gmikhailov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'gmikhailov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-22 12:03:30.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/static/tests/functional/test_cluster_network.js', 'nailgun/static/tests/functional/nightly/test_cluster_network.js', 'nailgun/static/tests/functional/nightly/library/networks.js', 'nailgun/static/tests/functional/nightly/test_ironic_cluster.js', 'nailgun/static/tests/functional/pages/common.js'], 'message': 'New "nightly" functional ui tests for fuel-web. Some updates for actual tests.

New "GUI support for Ironic" test group:
Enabling Ironic when create environment
Check Ironic item on Settings tab
Baremetal Network "IP Ranges" correct changing
Baremetal Network "IP Ranges" adding and deletion additional fields
Baremetal and other networks intersections
Baremetal Network "Use VLAN tagging" option works
Baremetal Network "Use VLAN tagging" option validation
Baremetal Network "CIDR" field validation
Baremetal Network "Use the whole CIDR" option works

New "Support network node groups" test group:
The same VLAN for different node network groups (Neutron tunneling segmentation)
Gateways appear for two or more node network groups (Neutron tunneling segmentation)
Can not create node network group with name of already existing group
"Default" network group the first in a list
Deletion of several node network groups one after another
Can not create node network group without saving changes
Switching between node network groups without saved changes
The same VLAN for different node network groups (Neutron VLAN segmentation)
Gateways appear for two or more node network groups (Neutron VLAN segmentation)
Validation between default and non-default groups
Validation Floating IP range with non-default group with other CIDR
Renaming of Default and non-default network groups
Correct bahaviour of long name for node network group
Node network group deletion
User can add and cannot rename new network group after deployment

Update for "test_cluster_network.js":
There is a little bit changes. So I guees we not need to duplicate these tests to "nightly" subfolder.

Update for "pages/common.js":
In case of unsaved changes cluster deletion is failed. This update fixed that.

Change-Id: Ie3bff39054a2948861600224b80cfef95be4728e
'}]
commit_message:
New "nightly" functional ui tests for fuel-web. Some updates for actual tests.

New "GUI support for Ironic" test group:
Enabling Ironic when create environment
Check Ironic item on Settings tab
Baremetal Network "IP Ranges" correct changing
Baremetal Network "IP Ranges" adding and deletion additional fields
Baremetal and other networks intersections
Baremetal Network "Use VLAN tagging" option works
Baremetal Network "Use VLAN tagging" option validation
Baremetal Network "CIDR" field validation
Baremetal Network "Use the whole CIDR" option works

New "Support network node groups" test group:
The same VLAN for different node network groups (Neutron tunneling segmentation)
Gateways appear for two or more node network groups (Neutron tunneling segmentation)
Can not create node network group with name of already existing group
"Default" network group the first in a list
Deletion of several node network groups one after another
Can not create node network group without saving changes
Switching between node network groups without saved changes
The same VLAN for different node network groups (Neutron VLAN segmentation)
Gateways appear for two or more node network groups (Neutron VLAN segmentation)
Validation between default and non-default groups
Validation Floating IP range with non-default group with other CIDR
Renaming of Default and non-default network groups
Correct bahaviour of long name for node network group
Node network group deletion
User can add and cannot rename new network group after deployment

Update for "test_cluster_network.js":
There is a little bit changes. So I guees we not need to duplicate these tests to "nightly" subfolder.

Update for "pages/common.js":
In case of unsaved changes cluster deletion is failed. This update fixed that.

Change-Id: Ie3bff39054a2948861600224b80cfef95be4728e

- Remove dhcp_delete_namespaces as deprecated according to [0]
- Remove dhcp_domain as deprecated according to [1]
- Allow customization of dns_domain (which replaces dhcp_domain) option
in neutron.conf

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1418079

commit_message:
Remove deprecated options dhcp_domain & dhcp_delete_namespaces

- Remove dhcp_delete_namespaces as deprecated according to [0]
- Remove dhcp_domain as deprecated according to [1]
- Allow customization of dns_domain (which replaces dhcp_domain) option
in neutron.conf

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1418079
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/liberty/config-reference/content/section_neutron-dhcp_agent.ini.html

Change-Id: Ic39632bd4b5a5cca2f8cc30527adf566f997bb96

subject: Renew auth token in delete_cleaning_ports() Neutron provider
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 10:10:21.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/dhcp/neutron.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/dhcp/test_neutron.py'], 'message': "Renew auth token in delete_cleaning_ports() Neutron provider

When cleaning is not async auth token can be expired while node
tear down, this caused error on delete Neutron's cleaning port.
This patch adds renew a token when it's near expiration.

Closes-bug: #1521548
Change-Id: Ia0b4f35878708e861e2dd7bbcd372409ebf4a129
"}]
commit_message:
Renew auth token in delete_cleaning_ports() Neutron provider

When cleaning is not async auth token can be expired while node
tear down, this caused error on delete Neutron's cleaning port.
This patch adds renew a token when it's near expiration.

Closes-bug: #1521548
Change-Id: Ia0b4f35878708e861e2dd7bbcd372409ebf4a129

commit_message:
Improve Nova Instance metering

This proposal try to avoid every compute-agents polling Nova API
periodically, that will reduce the workload of Nova api caused by
compute-agents polling.

Change-Id: Icdf75c5ee01f665b40a20aa2a8bf6b42a0ad3b3d
blueprint: improve-nova-instance-metering

commit_message:
Update puppet-swift module to current Mitaka version

Puppet-swift module doesn't contain any custom patches.
Its state is upstream state on 11 Jan (latest current commit).

Additional changes:

  * Disable mount check for swift devices

Partial implements blueprint puppet-mitaka-modules

Change-Id: Ib9571215d77f7fa3585aae32dd186a9a11520b97

commit_message:
Add more senlin resources to heat

Since senlin is stable now and it's time to add more senlin
resources in heat. This proposal will add senlin
node/policy/receiver resource and revise profile resource.

blueprint senlin-resources

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-27 13:56:57.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvrscheduler_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': "Rename confusing dvr_deletens_if_no_port

Method name and docstring are confusing: actually it does not
delete any namespaces, just returns info about which dvr routers

Change-Id: If0fde9b873961a65c2e258cdff6105889b9fbc60

commit_message:
Rename confusing dvr_deletens_if_no_port

Method name and docstring are confusing: actually it does not
delete any namespaces, just returns info about which dvr routers
should be removed from which agents.
The patch renames the method and updates it's docstring accordingly.

Change-Id: If0fde9b873961a65c2e258cdff6105889b9fbc60

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-01-28 05:07:11.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/tests/functional/sanity_check.py', 'muranodashboard/environments/tables.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1405788-2c8b2708e3bfc63f.yaml', 'muranodashboard/tests/functional/consts.py', 'muranodashboard/tests/functional/base.py', 'muranodashboard/environments/forms.py'], 'message': "Remove environment name restrictions

Since we don't use environments and environment templates names during
deployment process we don't need to check what is the name of the
environment. Now we should only keep it human-readable and check that
it exists.

commit_message:
Remove environment name restrictions

Since we don't use environments and environment templates names during
deployment process we don't need to check what is the name of the
environment. Now we should only keep it human-readable and check that
it exists.

Change-Id: I2d665b41deebf0c008d8b2b71802a1ab2c6673e8
Closes-Bug: #1405788

subject: Change Swift zero-size chunk behaviour
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-27 10:56:42.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/swift/store.py', 'glance_store/tests/unit/test_swift_store.py', 'glance_store/exceptions.py'], 'message': "Change Swift zero-size chunk behaviour

There is a difference in how Swift and radosgw behave when a zero
length write is aborted. Swift returns 499 and doesn't create an object,
but radosgw appears to creates a zero size object. Because of this, new
behaviour which was introduced to prevent zero-size chunks being written
worked for Swift, but appears not to work for the radosgw case.

This patch changes how we detect a zero size chunk so that no request
is made to the backend. We no longer rely on the Swift specific behaviour.

Conflicts:
        glance_store/_drivers/swift/store.py

Change-Id: I1a48e2eceaa6b07b8e5bbfd42fef6fd3d91f5834
Closes-bug: 1537721
"}]
commit_message:
Change Swift zero-size chunk behaviour

There is a difference in how Swift and radosgw behave when a zero
length write is aborted. Swift returns 499 and doesn't create an object,
but radosgw appears to creates a zero size object. Because of this, new
behaviour which was introduced to prevent zero-size chunks being written
worked for Swift, but appears not to work for the radosgw case.

This patch changes how we detect a zero size chunk so that no request
is made to the backend. We no longer rely on the Swift specific behaviour.

Conflicts:
        glance_store/_drivers/swift/store.py

Change-Id: I1a48e2eceaa6b07b8e5bbfd42fef6fd3d91f5834
Closes-bug: 1537721

subject: Scale back on how many warnings we issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-15 15:34:16.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/common/http.py'], 'message': 'Scale back on how many warnings we issue

* Remove "Request returned failure status" warning, it does not carry
  any helpful information for an operator (or anyone).
* Demote retry warnings to debug level. Retrying is essentially a normal
  thing in the real world, and currently we're spamming logs with warnings.
  http://logs.openstack.org/93/255793/3/gate/gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-agent_ssh/25175ed/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=TRACE

Change-Id: I6c40581b9dc5ab1fe3af4b882ede17a13edacc66
Closes-Bug: #1525002
(cherry picked from commit 8224859c02f525fa3b7dbe917d56b889b0dbb073)
'}]
commit_message:
Scale back on how many warnings we issue

* Remove "Request returned failure status" warning, it does not carry
  any helpful information for an operator (or anyone).
* Demote retry warnings to debug level. Retrying is essentially a normal
  thing in the real world, and currently we're spamming logs with warnings.
  http://logs.openstack.org/93/255793/3/gate/gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-agent_ssh/25175ed/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=TRACE

Change-Id: I6c40581b9dc5ab1fe3af4b882ede17a13edacc66
Closes-Bug: #1525002
(cherry picked from commit 8224859c02f525fa3b7dbe917d56b889b0dbb073)

commit_message:
Mark shared property in Firewall unsupported

Currently shared property is removed from neutron
firewall resource, so need to mark property shared
and attribute shared from heat resource plugin unsupported.
This change is due to [1] and [2].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1465440
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/194652/

Change-Id: I166c58364a36cc3ff919e03add8c81f0f19ffab9
Closes-bug: #1537677

commit_message:
Wrap ntpdate to timeout

As have some problems with retry hanging ntpdate outside,
wrap it to timeout with preserve status to better exit code
manage.

Change-Id: If2967106ef7267a454ca012a444eeda9b7c05793
Closes-Bug: #1533082

commit_message:
Run ntpdate with strace to understand what is going on

To better catch problems related to ntpdate hangs, wrap its run
into strace session and copy output to syslog.

Change-Id: I803f190e0e43a4ab674611d316517b7de8bea76f
Related-Bug: #1533082

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-01-21 07:51:08.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_keepalived.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py', 'etc/l3_agent.ini', 'neutron/agent/linux/keepalived.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/ha.py'], 'message': "WIP - Adding support for Keepalived health check

Currently we have no way of conditioning an HA router's
state with a custom events.
This is needed in some scenarios that require tracking a
specific entity (i.e. pinging a host's interface) or event
(i.e. a process that is no longer running).

This patch adds the ablitiy to hook user-defined scripts
that will be executed every interval (currently 5 sec).

These script's exit code is used by keepalived to
change the VR to FAULT state (script exited with
value other then 0 - fail)

If the VR is currently in FAULT state and the script
exited with code 0 (success) then the VR will move to
BACKUP. If the VR is MASTER and the script succeeds the
VR will remain MASTER.

The script file is defined in 'l3_agent.ini' under the new
parameter 'ha_health_check_script_path'. the file
specified in that parameter value will be used by keepalived
as a 'track_script' to be ran according to the new
'ha_health_check_script_interval' parameter in
'l3_agent.ini'. This parameter has a default value of
5 seconds.

DocImpact:
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_check_script_path' that can accept a full path
of a bash script. The script behavior should match the
details in this commit message above.
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_check_script_interval' which will determine
the VRRP health check interval in seconds.

Closes-Bug: #1365461
Co-Authored-By: Yoni Shafrir <yshafrir@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iaa9c8494f47770ab8379546a211116c17ab98a62
"}]
commit_message:
WIP - Adding support for Keepalived health check

Currently we have no way of conditioning an HA router's
state with a custom events.
This is needed in some scenarios that require tracking a
specific entity (i.e. pinging a host's interface) or event
(i.e. a process that is no longer running).

This patch adds the ablitiy to hook user-defined scripts
that will be executed every interval (currently 5 sec).

These script's exit code is used by keepalived to
change the VR to FAULT state (script exited with
value other then 0 - fail)

If the VR is currently in FAULT state and the script
exited with code 0 (success) then the VR will move to
BACKUP. If the VR is MASTER and the script succeeds the
VR will remain MASTER.

The script file is defined in 'l3_agent.ini' under the new
parameter 'ha_health_check_script_path'. the file
specified in that parameter value will be used by keepalived
as a 'track_script' to be ran according to the new
'ha_health_check_script_interval' parameter in
'l3_agent.ini'. This parameter has a default value of
5 seconds.

DocImpact:
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_check_script_path' that can accept a full path
of a bash script. The script behavior should match the
details in this commit message above.
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_check_script_interval' which will determine
the VRRP health check interval in seconds.

Closes-Bug: #1365461
Co-Authored-By: Yoni Shafrir <yshafrir@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iaa9c8494f47770ab8379546a211116c17ab98a62

commit_message:
create_object should not add an ID if not present in the DB model

Change I192793aa433606a1508f24564c54164f961018d9 introduced a way
to handle DB objects that don't have 'id' as primary field.
Anyway create_object should be modified not to add the 'id' field
if not present in the model.

Change-Id: I14e4e32255caf9244ff2793aef142b1a6fa57de3

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-25 22:13:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/ra.py'], 'message': "Increase default IPv6 router advertisement interval

The current values of min:3 and max:10 mean radvd is sending
an RA about every 7 seconds, which can be excessive when we
have thousands of routers.  Let's relax it by 10x since most
VMs will send a Router Solicition at boot, obviating the need
for a small interval.

Related-Bug: #1532338
Change-Id: Ie0a411f67d10ec1469841d70fb643409f77be56f
"}]
commit_message:
Increase default IPv6 router advertisement interval

The current values of min:3 and max:10 mean radvd is sending
an RA about every 7 seconds, which can be excessive when we
have thousands of routers.  Let's relax it by 10x since most
VMs will send a Router Solicition at boot, obviating the need
for a small interval.

Related-Bug: #1532338
Change-Id: Ie0a411f67d10ec1469841d70fb643409f77be56f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-20 09:59:27.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/service-groups-and-objects.rst'], 'message': 'Service Group and Service Objects

This spec allows the creation of service groups and objects
In a traditional networking system, the term "service"
refers to a type of connection between two endpoints
that is visible as it passes through the networking system.
The âserviceâ can be a layer 4 protocol number combined
with source and destination ports, all of which are visible
from the L4 payload and by deep packet inspection, can be based
on an application ID and L7 fields such as URL strings.
The customized service objects can then be grouped together
to form a service group.
The service object and service group abstractions proposed
in this spec will be first consumed by the FWaaS implementation,
but its applicability is not limited to FWaaS and can be leveraged
in other features where such service definition and grouping
is required.

Implements: blueprint service-groups-objects
Authored-by: badveli vishnuvardhan <badveli_vishnuus@yahoo.com>
Change-Id: I610a1e1ede2a4147738bc595e026437c035e0764
'}]
commit_message:
Service Group and Service Objects

This spec allows the creation of service groups and objects
In a traditional networking system, the term "service"
refers to a type of connection between two endpoints
that is visible as it passes through the networking system.
The âserviceâ can be a layer 4 protocol number combined
with source and destination ports, all of which are visible
from the L4 payload and by deep packet inspection, can be based
on an application ID and L7 fields such as URL strings.
The customized service objects can then be grouped together
to form a service group.
The service object and service group abstractions proposed
in this spec will be first consumed by the FWaaS implementation,
but its applicability is not limited to FWaaS and can be leveraged
in other features where such service definition and grouping
is required.

Implements: blueprint service-groups-objects
Authored-by: badveli vishnuvardhan <badveli_vishnuus@yahoo.com>
Change-Id: I610a1e1ede2a4147738bc595e026437c035e0764

The current PostgreSQL driver only look for the host option in URL,

commit_message:
pgsql: fix hostname parsing

The current PostgreSQL driver only look for the host option in URL,
whereas it should also look for the hostname in the URL!

This patch makes sure you can override URL values with options, but also
read those URL values.

Change-Id: I70a13c2f61bdd3a04fd2b0ed4cbf8b2ca96cfec6

commit_message:
Revert "Pass host when call attach to Cinder"

Older Cinder blows up because of the extra parameter in the detach call
to Cinder. We need to find another way to pass the info.

This reverts commit d31bb4be8edbce6719258ae1cbbb583a2c3c3a28.

Closes-Bug: #1538620
Change-Id: I99335827ee6492d3f5629850be8e7cbe19371830

commit_message:
Have a single ryu app. Have all DF apps be dispatched from there.

Have a single ryu application. All Dragonflow applications get openflow
messages and events from there.

Dragonflow applications can register for packet-in events received from
a specific OF table.

A little method renaming to keep all names appear in one form (all be add_*,
remove_*, or update_*)

Change-Id: Ie9bb770476fc8a5cd042195f7cc303302c1857e1

This change properly configures the cache/memcache_servers configuration
for keystone. Due to an upstream keystone module bug, this setting is
not properly configured and there is no support for configuring it
within the keystone module at this time. Without this setting, the
keystone cache is enabled without properly configuring the memcache
servers which results in errors and excessive backend communications.

(cherry picked from commit 2823183159d51dc105dacef8e82d4f3cddbd5eeb)

commit_message:
Configure keystone cache memcache servers

This change properly configures the cache/memcache_servers configuration
for keystone. Due to an upstream keystone module bug, this setting is
not properly configured and there is no support for configuring it
within the keystone module at this time. Without this setting, the
keystone cache is enabled without properly configuring the memcache
servers which results in errors and excessive backend communications.

Change-Id: I6ca90dfb32c824aeff8022ba70d7b988edae6486
Partial-Bug: #1530178
(cherry picked from commit 2823183159d51dc105dacef8e82d4f3cddbd5eeb)

commit_message:
Add return-request-id-to-caller function(2/5)

Add return-request-id-to-caller function to
resources and resource managers in the following files.
The methods in the resource class and resource manager return
a wrapper class that has 'request_ids' property.
The caller can get request ids of the callee via the property.

* novaclient/v2/agents.py
* novaclient/v2/aggregates.py
* novaclient/v2/availability_zones.py
* novaclient/v2/certs.py
* novaclient/v2/cloudpipe.py
* novaclient/v2/fixed_ips.py
* novaclient/v2/flavor_access.py
* novaclient/v2/flavors.py
* novaclient/v2/floating_ip_dns.py
* novaclient/v2/floating_ip_pools.py
* novaclient/v2/floating_ips_bulk.py
* novaclient/v2/floating_ips.py
* novaclient/v2/fping.py
* novaclient/v2/hosts.py
* novaclient/v2/hypervisors.py
* novaclient/v2/images.py

Co-authored-by: Ankit Agrawal <ankit11.agrawal@nttdata.com>
Change-Id: Ic624d532f1a468dd45105bbb5aa6d8a730984338
Implements: blueprint return-request-id-to-caller

commit_message:
Update to swift hash parameters

This change adds the ability to configure the swift_hash_path_prefix for
swift. Additionally it deprecated swift_hash_suffix in favor of a new
parameter called swift_hash_path_suffix for consistency.

Change-Id: I26935fe21af42b488f4479c4e50e8f481a75ea40
Closes-Bug: #1505269

commit_message:
Add 'once_deployed' flag to cluster that forbids stop deployment

When cluster is successfuly deployed, that is, has 'operational' status,
'once_deployed' key is added to generated attributes of the cluster.
This flag then is used to determine wether stop action is allowed for
the cluster.

Change-Id: I3ada735c066db9f912f8f4bb6b5cef341a057977
Partial-Bug: #1529691

subject: Enable debounce in filter fields.
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-01-27 18:56:42.000000000', 'files': ['app/views/tests.html', 'app/views/home.html'], 'message': "Enable debounce in filter fields.

This enables the 'debounce' option for filter fields using ng-model,
adding a 250ms delay before the model is updated. This should greatly
improve responsiveness when filtering on large, sorted lists by
waiting until the user has stopped typing in the field before
applying the filter. On pages with complex elements (e.g. home) or
very large numbers of elements (e.g. tests), this makes filtering
cause far less browser lag, and eliminates delays before typed
characters are shown on screen.

Change-Id: Ib2b05ffd8b409673a6d8715b711c44f1e35148e9
"}]
commit_message:
Enable debounce in filter fields.

This enables the 'debounce' option for filter fields using ng-model,
adding a 250ms delay before the model is updated. This should greatly
improve responsiveness when filtering on large, sorted lists by
waiting until the user has stopped typing in the field before
applying the filter. On pages with complex elements (e.g. home) or
very large numbers of elements (e.g. tests), this makes filtering
cause far less browser lag, and eliminates delays before typed
characters are shown on screen.

Change-Id: Ib2b05ffd8b409673a6d8715b711c44f1e35148e9

Add return-request-id-to-caller function to
'Server' resource and 'ServerManager'.
The methods in the resource class and resource manager return
a wrapper class that has 'request_ids' property.
The caller can get request ids of the callee via the property.

* novaclient/v2/servers.py

the Resource class contain a 'request_ids' attribute

This change is required to return 'request_id' from

This patch is one of a series of patches for implementing
return-request-id-to-caller.

Co-authored-by: Ankit Agrawal <ankit11.agrawal@nttdata.com>

Implements: blueprint return-request-id-to-caller
"}]
commit_message:
Add wrapper classes for return-request-id-to-caller

Added wrapper classes which are inherited from base data types str,
list, tuple and dict. Each of these wrapper classes and
the Resource class contain a 'request_ids' attribute
which is populated with a 'x-compute-request-id' or
a 'x-openstack-request-id' received in a header from a response body.

This change is required to return 'request_id' from
client to log request_id mappings of cross projects.

This patch is one of a series of patches for implementing
return-request-id-to-caller.

Co-authored-by: Ankit Agrawal <ankit11.agrawal@nttdata.com>
Change-Id: I422c4f4ee59991ca89a0a16f548b537c8b61bb97
Implements: blueprint return-request-id-to-caller

subject: Fix iptables to allow new connections between KVM networks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-24 11:02:14.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/lib/osbash/kvm-functions.sh'], 'message': "Fix iptables to allow new connections between KVM networks

The network interfaces we created until Liberty differed from the
install-guide in that the node network interfaces in the public network
had an IP address, whereas the install-guide listed them as unnumbered
interfaces.

For Liberty, we are making the interfaces in the public network
unnumbered, too. With this change, the management network and
our pseudo-public network (203.0.113.0/24) can no longer establish
connections with each other, because the way libvirt configures iptables
only forwards established and related connections between these networks,
but not new ones.

Our scripts are supposted to leave the host system alone, but since
libvirt already messes with the host system's iptables and the training
cluster will not work without patching up libvirt's configuration work,
this change seems justified.

The patch modifies libvirt's forwarding rule for virbr interfaces (other
than virbr0 which is used for the default netowrk) and removes the
modifications before destroying the networks so libvirt recognizes the
rule again as its own.

One downside is that this patch prevents libvirt from removing these
forwarding rules if it is called in some other context.

Change-Id: I1e4134cb04e83c3ff69f89f8a1bc4b6ec586e6cd
"}]
commit_message:
Fix iptables to allow new connections between KVM networks

The network interfaces we created until Liberty differed from the
install-guide in that the node network interfaces in the public network
had an IP address, whereas the install-guide listed them as unnumbered
interfaces.

For Liberty, we are making the interfaces in the public network
unnumbered, too. With this change, the management network and
our pseudo-public network (203.0.113.0/24) can no longer establish
connections with each other, because the way libvirt configures iptables
only forwards established and related connections between these networks,
but not new ones.

Our scripts are supposted to leave the host system alone, but since
libvirt already messes with the host system's iptables and the training
cluster will not work without patching up libvirt's configuration work,
this change seems justified.

The patch modifies libvirt's forwarding rule for virbr interfaces (other
than virbr0 which is used for the default netowrk) and removes the
modifications before destroying the networks so libvirt recognizes the
rule again as its own.

One downside is that this patch prevents libvirt from removing these
forwarding rules if it is called in some other context.

Change-Id: I1e4134cb04e83c3ff69f89f8a1bc4b6ec586e6cd

nova-compute can sometimes race with the neutron linuxbrige agent
to create bridges, which can cause an instance to fail. This

commit_message:
Ignore bridge already exists error when creating bridge

nova-compute can sometimes race with the neutron linuxbrige agent
to create bridges, which can cause an instance to fail. This
patch changes ensure_bridge() to ignore that error and continue.

Change-Id: I019a5d96442802d89e9a152c0adf6030daab1a61
Closes-Bug: 1471916

Additionally adjust the _extremely_ verbose logging from INFO to

Change-Id: I88bf660134192f11732d012985df5c4f688419ba

commit_message:
Remove the libvirt socket

We use tcp connection rather than socket so we can remove the config
options related to it.

Additionally adjust the _extremely_ verbose logging from INFO to
WARNING.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I88bf660134192f11732d012985df5c4f688419ba

commit_message:
Plugin package v5.0.0 support introduced

Plugins v5.0.0 use task-based deployment directives using tasks
v2.0.0 with cross-dependencies and per-task strategy.

V4.0.0 allows both experimental and granular deployment directives
(tasks v1.0.0 and tasks v2.0.0) and using them according to `task_deploy`
environment flag setting.

Change-Id: I697dc22a58a9ff2ad8bd9d955d2b2c5351c746ab
Closes-Bug: #1533771

commit_message:
Tempest API tests on /actions

Following the blueprint tempest-basic-set-up which implemented a first
batch of tests, this one adds a new set of API tests on actions.

I also added extra check on actions within the dummy strategy
scenario.

commit_message:

Adapt to the cumulative change in Horizon i9n tests being merged in

commit_message:
Take into consideration use_ssl hash for vncprotocol

Use use_ssl hash when create nova nova hash, cause use_ssl can define
public ssl endpoints when default public_ssl hash is disabled.

Change-Id: Id563b7c52d69408eebef4eb798e0b499326ea58a
Closes-Bug: #1531143

commit_message:
Improve autonested_transaction

Currently in method autonested_transaction from db.api is decided
 begin(nested) or begin(subtransactions) should be used based on
catching the the exception. Instead of this it can be checking is
there active session or not.

Change-Id: I2b5951bcffef99323e3d68034ae9a3fd9fa1970c

subject: Limit max service workers by RAM
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-27 16:17:31.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/openstack-cinder/openstack-cinder.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/openstack-network/server-config.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/rabbitmq/rabbitmq_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/nova/controller.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/globals/globals.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/swift/swift_spec.rb', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/keystone/keystone_spec.rb', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/glance/glance_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/openstack-controller/openstack-controller.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-cinder/openstack-cinder_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/ceilometer/controller.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-controller/openstack-controller_spec.rb', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/ceilometer/controller_spec.rb', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-network/server-config_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/glance/glance.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/keystone/keystone.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/templates/globals_yaml.erb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/swift/swift.pp'], 'message': "Limit max service workers by RAM

Intoduce the worker RAM ratio to define the total RAM every single
worker of all service types may consume. More services share the
same node, more RAM ratio should be given to the workers.
The default value assumes there are 20 different types of workers
limited by 100Mb each (or 10 types by 200Mb and so on).

(tl;dr)
Without this fix, we use hardcoded thresholds for service
workers (process/eventlet based) of 16 processes. And for rabbit -
of 100 threads. While the actual values for workers are evaluated
as only CPUs based, with the hardcoded thresholds applied.

This is a problem as the limiting global tresholds must depend on the
physical RAM as well. We don't want 16 workers for an 8CPU, 1G RAM node
to be the same as for an 8CPU & 128G RAM one. Note, that this problem
has nothing to the custom service_workers configurable per each service
in hiera. The global threshold applies only when those are not defined
as well.

The solution is to introduce the workers_ratio (configurable in hiera).
This represents the average workers-to-RAM ratio for a multi process
workers of each known type. The default value is 2000, which is like
10 generic workers of different services to consume 200M each,
or the same as 20 workers X 100M, if there are 20 distinct services.

The workers_ratio serves as an argument for a new global treshold
function limiting the maximum amount of workers for the each distinct
service type. So, there will be no more hardcoded limits of 16 / 100.
Instead, those will be evaluated as a function F(RAM, workers_ratio).
Examples:
F(1G, 2000)=1 global workers threshold for processes;
F(2G, 2000)=2;
F(8G, 2000)=5;
F(64G, 2000)=F(128G, 2000)=30

And the service_workers will be evaluated as:
$threads = min($workers_max,max(12*$physicalprocessorcount,30))
$processess = min(max($::processorcount, 2), $workers_max)
Instead as it was before:
$threads = min(100,max(12*$physicalprocessorcount,30))
$processess = min(max($::processorcount, 2), 16)

(Note that the effective threads value will be doubled for the rabbitmq
thread workers. We don't change other thread workers, like apache2, as they
are implemented to depend on the available RAM already)

Also, add missing noop tests for service workers, address todo for the
rabbitmq in the openstack::nova::controller class (no more needed as
was removed).

Closes-bug: #1529096

Change-Id: Ib90838cff05419d824d064e93b13b627b5a07fea
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit aa999f7f5b3e75f5f5af1f17d0586edb88c9dc8f)
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Limit max service workers by RAM

Intoduce the worker RAM ratio to define the total RAM every single
worker of all service types may consume. More services share the
same node, more RAM ratio should be given to the workers.
The default value assumes there are 20 different types of workers
limited by 100Mb each (or 10 types by 200Mb and so on).

(tl;dr)
Without this fix, we use hardcoded thresholds for service
workers (process/eventlet based) of 16 processes. And for rabbit -
of 100 threads. While the actual values for workers are evaluated
as only CPUs based, with the hardcoded thresholds applied.

This is a problem as the limiting global tresholds must depend on the
physical RAM as well. We don't want 16 workers for an 8CPU, 1G RAM node
to be the same as for an 8CPU & 128G RAM one. Note, that this problem
has nothing to the custom service_workers configurable per each service
in hiera. The global threshold applies only when those are not defined
as well.

The solution is to introduce the workers_ratio (configurable in hiera).
This represents the average workers-to-RAM ratio for a multi process
workers of each known type. The default value is 2000, which is like
10 generic workers of different services to consume 200M each,
or the same as 20 workers X 100M, if there are 20 distinct services.

The workers_ratio serves as an argument for a new global treshold
function limiting the maximum amount of workers for the each distinct
service type. So, there will be no more hardcoded limits of 16 / 100.
Instead, those will be evaluated as a function F(RAM, workers_ratio).
Examples:
F(1G, 2000)=1 global workers threshold for processes;
F(2G, 2000)=2;
F(8G, 2000)=5;
F(64G, 2000)=F(128G, 2000)=30

And the service_workers will be evaluated as:
$threads = min($workers_max,max(12*$physicalprocessorcount,30))
$processess = min(max($::processorcount, 2), $workers_max)
Instead as it was before:
$threads = min(100,max(12*$physicalprocessorcount,30))
$processess = min(max($::processorcount, 2), 16)

(Note that the effective threads value will be doubled for the rabbitmq
thread workers. We don't change other thread workers, like apache2, as they
are implemented to depend on the available RAM already)

Also, add missing noop tests for service workers, address todo for the
rabbitmq in the openstack::nova::controller class (no more needed as
was removed).

Closes-bug: #1529096

Change-Id: Ib90838cff05419d824d064e93b13b627b5a07fea
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit aa999f7f5b3e75f5f5af1f17d0586edb88c9dc8f)
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
More info in Zaqar config-ref storage options

This patch adds some important information about zaqar's (Message
service) storage options:

1. The information about which storage options are active depending on
the chosen storage back end.
2. The general information about storage pipelines.
3. Currently possible values (stages) for each one of the storage
pipelines.
4. The information on how to enable notifications feature of zaqar.
5. A brief information about possibility to add external stages to the
storage pipelines.

Some typos are fixed by patch:
In some articles the word "backend" is replaced to "back end".

Change-Id: Iffc9ea9dcefdb76e15554e9223e9e8dbbe8288cd
Closes-Bug: 1534852

commit_message:
Reset master score if we decide to restart RabbitMQ on timeout

Doing otherwise might not trigger the restart while it is clearly
needed.

Upstream PR: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/pull/560

Change-Id: I480ebaddc98fa0784098efbf0c5ab8c512c8661d
Closes-Bug: #1513421

commit_message:
Fix task dependencies for swift tasks

After introducing separate tasks for primary-controller for task
based deployment feature some swift tasks has wrong dependencies.
This patch fixes them.

Change-Id: I920d789396f11c92e2d76d3eaa9df12e5c582259
Closes-bug: #1538193
(cherry picked from commit 9552480b65f2061ec096c3d0fefdd6cf63d29f59)

This patchset implements:

* remove unused function filter_nodes
* remove some unused code, related to nodes list
* new parser function get_node_key_name() for generating immutable node key name
* fix parser function roles_include() for using network_metadata
* use roles_include() if need instead directly lookup into network_metadata
* fix some manifests for use network_matadata/nodes

Change-Id: I2e6b1cd5cb75263efc995aa9f62bd3073abed1b8
Related-bug: #1531128
Related-bug: #1538220

commit_message:
No more use nodes list.

Nodes list is deprecated, beause incompatible with network-roles model.
Network metadata should be used instead.

This patchset implements:
* remove nodes list from fixtures
* remove unused function filter_nodes
* remove some unused code, related to nodes list
* new parser function get_node_key_name() for generating immutable node key name
* fix parser function roles_include() for using network_metadata
* use roles_include() if need instead directly lookup into network_metadata
* fix some manifests for use network_matadata/nodes

Change-Id: I2e6b1cd5cb75263efc995aa9f62bd3073abed1b8
Related-bug: #1531128
Related-bug: #1538220

commit_message:
Reduce ironic-inspector and ironic-functional timeouts

These jobs run between 30 and 50 minutes currently, using 120 minutes
as timeout is overkill. Reduce it to 75 minutes.

Change-Id: I9f17b0baf8e424ddfda3028753b2007700a58ef8

commit_message:
fix ceilometerclient gate

this patch creates a template which each of the projects inherit and
set PROJECTS accordingly as per sdagues suggestion. this ensures the job
runs correctly for all gates the jobs resides on INCLUDING the original
ceilometerclient gate which was and still is failing[1].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/08/235208/3/check/gate-ceilometer-dsvm-integration/a637ac7/logs/devstack-gate-setup-workspace-new.txt.gz

Change-Id: I2df7f5d78bf8acc0ee1d9d78a41aa7773919d2bf

commit_message:
Make 'gate-manila-buildimage-generic' job voting

add to gate queue.

commit_message:
Run python-jobs against astara

We'd like to run the docs job so this replaces the existing py27/pep8
jobs with python-jobs

commit_message:
Glance artifacts repository can be properly enabled

Previously environment variable 'MURANO_PACKAGES_SERVICE' was missed,
and GLARE can't be properly configured even if it was enabled during
deployment.

Change-Id: I8bec86da2617d7fe315f9d7f65e26bf602b2244f
Related-Bug: #1534583

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-08-03 11:03:49.000000000', 'files': ['packages/rpm/module.mk'], 'message': 'Make sure the release version of bootstrap, centos-image and docker packages is increasing

We need to be sure that packages (in packages-late target):
 - fuel-bootstrap-image
 - fuel-target-centos-images
 - fuel-docker-images
will increase their release numbers by 1 continuously

commit_message:
Make sure the release version of bootstrap, centos-image and docker packages is increasing

We need to be sure that packages (in packages-late target):
 - fuel-bootstrap-image
 - fuel-target-centos-images
 - fuel-docker-images
will increase their release numbers by 1 continuously
in order to be able to ship them in updates repositories.

Change-Id: I5b52647a9f808d7772a896f4d3c12a9861ab2f32
Blueprint: package-fuel-components

Nailgun will always match pattern 'node-[0-9]', but backend provides

commit_message:
Fix manifest behaviour on hostname change

Manifest relies on fact that 'target_node' value that is provided by
Nailgun will always match pattern 'node-[0-9]', but backend provides
hostname that can be changed by user.

Closes-bug: #1534851
Change-Id: I4a9984d683bd741785e1f9f70476ed74fcc0c478

subject: Fix cluster resize service call
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-28 07:25:14.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/service.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_clusters.py'], 'message': "Fix cluster resize service call

This patch fixes the problem aroused when the request is only about
chaning the min_size and/or max_size rather than a real resize
operation. This is a fix for making functional tests happy. Will add
patches for cluster_resize call in another patch. (Cannot believe we
don't have unit tests for this call).

Change-Id: I628e5865d642c3d7fd8885bc4f18b0e607f1cea6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cluster resize service call

This patch fixes the problem aroused when the request is only about
chaning the min_size and/or max_size rather than a real resize
operation. This is a fix for making functional tests happy. Will add
patches for cluster_resize call in another patch. (Cannot believe we
don't have unit tests for this call).

Change-Id: I628e5865d642c3d7fd8885bc4f18b0e607f1cea6

commit_message:
Plugin package v5.0.0 support introduced

Plugins v5.0.0 use task-based deployment directives using tasks
v2.0.0 with cross-dependencies and per-task strategy.

V4.0.0 allows both experimental and granular deployment directives
(tasks v1.0.0 and tasks v2.0.0) and using them according to `task_deploy`
environment flag setting.

Change-Id: I697dc22a58a9ff2ad8bd9d955d2b2c5351c746ab
Closes-Bug: #1533771

resource-providers: Introduce resource classes

Adds a blueprint specification for a new lookup table and Nova object
for the different classes of quantitative resources that may be used in
the system.

commit_message:
Fixing HNAS XML parser

HNAS XML parser does not handles situations where the user
could accidentally insert a blank space in the parameter value
breaking the driver in execution time. With this fix, an
error is raised in the driver setup.

Closes-bug: #1537758
Change-Id: If553647563638a5c9a09441ad2ec40ed13a0ece2

commit_message:
neutron wrong command display with u

for this issue, just make it to be string in
shell.py
example:
before:
neutron ad
Unknown command [u'ad']

after:
neutron ad
Unknown command ['ad']

add %s to make error information to be string

decode argv(list) to unicode mode
Change-Id: I8ce7d97c8d3f93e2806ba0e4f687c78ba6b60cae

commit_message:
Enable all extension for server PUT API sample tests

As extensions options has been deprecated, API sample tests
should run against all extension enable.

This commit enables all extensions for server PUT API tests and
remove its specific extensions tests and sample files.

Adding a hack for other tests which are still running with specific
extensions. That is needed to avoid all tests updates in single commit.

Partially implements blueprint api-sample-tests-with-all-extensions

Change-Id: I9c44da3d9df39c1db0948194502be52f4f15acf2

commit_message:
Install guide: add warning about EPEL w/ RDO repositories

Due to some EPEL updates breaking backwards compatibility (e.g: hiera-3.0.4)
RDO repositories are now self-contained and recommend disabling EPEL

Change-Id: I3a7aa53aee658202cd61b491808dc611ed9fec65
(cherry picked from commit 6df431b8797dd46a3056ca19a8d86a5b0802efca)

subject: Fix DB coherency problem (again)
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-28 07:20:30.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/db/test_event_api.py', 'senlin/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Fix DB coherency problem (again)

We have spent a lot time on getting the DB concurrency done right. So
far we are still getting reports that some actions' status are not
refreshed even after the database records are correctly updated. This is
very annoying.

This patch proposes a change to enforce 'expire_on_commit' so that
(hopefully) in-memory data will be expired to relfect the DB changes.

Change-Id: I9822b56ba0620125dab580d7db1773f4289fd8ec
"}]
commit_message:
Fix DB coherency problem (again)

We have spent a lot time on getting the DB concurrency done right. So
far we are still getting reports that some actions' status are not
refreshed even after the database records are correctly updated. This is
very annoying.

This patch proposes a change to enforce 'expire_on_commit' so that
(hopefully) in-memory data will be expired to relfect the DB changes.

Change-Id: I9822b56ba0620125dab580d7db1773f4289fd8ec

commit_message:
Update MANIFEST.in

So that "python ./setup.py sdist" produces the same tarball
regardless of SKIP_GIT_SDIST setting or the availability of
.git directory.

Importantly, make sure to include migration scripts.

Closes-Bug: #1538894
Change-Id: I758a1f9dca500ab2de02a82618683e8cc7c0b89a

commit_message:
Enable os_inherit on Tempest

Since Ifac71f7415f21c402f6e00c5264e972b0e80388c in Mitaka, the
os_inherit of Keystone is enable on the default config.
In addition, Tempest is branchless now. So we need to enable
the corresponding Tempest tests with DevStack for master branch.

Change-Id: I3a92397d7bc62c3ec156281696d5c22504a86cb3
Depends-on: Ic67ce4da124ea759fdaaf52aef17e8a1581bc3a8

commit_message:
Add entity and name attribute to EntityNotFound

Since we use EntityNotFound for a bunch of not found cases.
We should have entity and name as attribute for cases that we need to
make sure the correctness when exception happens.

Change-Id: I782c372723f188bab38656e5b7cc401d23808ffb
